listening.name: Listening
listening.description: Shorter sessions focused on mindful listening

finished.title: Session Complete!
finished.message: Great job completing your conversation session.

prep: Take a moment to arrive and settle in.
Take a few deep breaths together.
Open yourself to what may come.
transition: Take time to process what you heard.
cooldown: Honor the exchange that took place.

cards.title: Schedule Agreement
cards.content: Set a fixed weekly time (e.g., 90 min) and a start time.

cards.title: Create Disturbance-Free Space
cards.content: Ensure a quiet environment without distractions or visitors.

cards.title: Establish Clear Rules
cards.content: Agree on a fixed speaking time (e.g., 15 min) and strict listening protocol.

cards.title: Ritual Foundation
cards.content: Make the session a fixed, non-negotiable ritual that isn't skipped.

cards.title: Radical Empathy
cards.content: Your only task is to listen with full attention, without your own agenda.

cards.title: Strict Taboos
cards.content: Absolute prohibition: No interrupting, judging, advising, or non-verbal rejection (e.g., eye-rolling).

cards.title: Embrace Silence
cards.content: When your partner pauses to think, remain still even if the silence feels long.

cards.title: Speaker/Listener Roles
cards.content: The speaker says 'I think/feel...', the listener only listens attentively without judgment.

cards.title: Call Time-Out
cards.content: Stop the conversation as soon as you or your partner feel emotionally overwhelmed.

cards.title: Calm Down Physically
cards.content: Use the pause for calming activities (e.g., reading, walking), not to brood.

cards.title: Resume Conversation
cards.content: Resume the dialogue within 24 hours to avoid the conflict from escalating.

speaker.title: Speaker Guidelines
rules: Absolute taboos: No interrupting, judging, advising, dismissive reactions

listener.title: Listener Guidelines
rules: Absolute taboos: No interrupting, commenting, judging, or non-verbal dismissal
